newsitem.title: FRANCE: Nice to appoint freight marketing officer.
newsitem.headline: Nice to appoint freight marketing officer.

text.p: Nice-Cote d'Azur Airport said it planned to appoint a freight marketing officer later this year.
"At present, no one from our marketing department concentrates on freight full-time and the aim is create a new post to do just that," an airport authority official told Reuters.
The official said the post would probably be filled by September 1997.
Provisional figures for January-April air cargo traffic at Nice showed 5,674 tonnes flown, an increase of 2.3 percent on 1996 levels, the official added.
International traffic was up 23.8 percent on the first four months of last year at 2,344 tonnes.

"The strong growth in international traffic is probably due to more belly capacity available due to carriers either switching to bigger aircraft such as British Airways or increasing frequencies as Lufthansa and KLM have done."
The Air France group generates the major part of "bellyhold" cargo traffic handled at Nice Airport.

Express operators, United Parcel Service and DHL Worldwide Express operate scheduled feeder flights to and from Nice as part of their intra-European air cargo network. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
